snippet: An analysis of dust from 1,200 homes across the continental United States provides new information about the fungal and bacterial communities within.
abstract: Dr Noah Fierer study of house dust published in Proceedings of the Royal Society B finds that types of bacteria in houses varied based on female-to-male ratio of residents and if pets lived there, but notes that indoor fungi grows based on location of home.
lead_paragraph: An analysis of dust from 1,200 homes across the continental United States provides new information about the fungal and bacterial communities within.

headline.print_headline: Microbiology: A Home’s Story, Told in Dust, Bacteria and Fungi
headline.main: A Home’s Story, Told in Dust, Bacteria and Fungi

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B (Journal)
